data.title: Film and TV History on February 13
data.meta_description: Important events in film and TV for the 13th of February. Browse important and interesting events in film and TV on February 13.
data.text:
KRCG TV channel 13 in Jefferson City, MO (CBS) begins broadcasting

Music Recording

Frank Sinatra launches Reprise label, after a failed attempt to buy the Verve label;

16th National Film Awards (India): "Goopy Gyne Bagha Byne" wins the Golden Lotus

Cabaret

Film adaptation of "Cabaret", directed by Bob Fosse, based on John Kander and Fred Ebb's musical of the same name, starring Liza Minnelli, Michael York, and Joel Grey is released

31st Berlin International Film Festival: "Hurry, Hurry!" wins the Golden Bear

42nd Berlin International Film Festival: "Grand Canyon" wins the Golden Bear

Berlin Film Festival

47th Berlin International Film Festival: "The People vs. Larry Flynt" wins the Golden Bear

BAFTA Awards

64th British Academy Film Awards (BAFTAs): "The King's Speech" Best Film, David Fincher Best Director

Film & TV History

Harrison Ford involved in a near miss while flying a plane at John Wayne Airport, Orange County

Super Bowl

Super Bowl LVI halftime show features Hip Hop legends Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Kendrick Lamar and Mary J. Blige, Eminem and 50 Cent

February in Film & TV

Final Deadly Performance of a Twisted Actor
